title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: AVhen I was very young, I usually passed the school vacation, first at Mr Menzies', of St Germains, and afterwards at Seton House, when the family came to live there upon the sale of their estate. I was very often there, as 1 was a great favourite of the lady's, one of the Sinclairs of Stevenson, and of her two daughters, who were two or three years older than I was.
